pullRequest.title: Commands-Test should also run with JAVA_HOME

nodes.bodyText: aQute.lib.io.IO.JAVA_HOME is a static holding the location of the JAVA_HOME folder. Please use it. Also, this should be done in a @BeforeEach method rather than a static method since this is JUnit 5 test case. The @BeforeEach method can set a field with the proper java command path which is then referenced from the test methods.

beforeCommit.message:
Commands-Test should also run with JAVA_HOME

Signed-off-by: Stefan Bischof <stbischof@bipolis.org>

afterCommit.message:
Commands-Test should also run with JAVA_HOME

Signed-off-by: Stefan Bischof <stbischof@bipolis.org>

nodes.bodyText: I just realized that this will fail if the absolute path string contains a space since the full string is parsed by spaces (This is why no one should really use the full command string). So for this test method, you will need to revert to the prior state (using simple java command) and delete the final assert on the execute method. We have confirmed the execution works in testSimple and this method confirms the full argument parsing, so we can avoid the assert on the execute here.

commit.message:
